name: Dogū - picture of the earthen figure 山形土偶 kept in the Tezos blockchain
description:
I was looking for the best picture on a digital watch screen. First, I thought ☕️coffee☕️ would be great to look at (most of us need caffeine always). Then next, I thought I'd want to see an ancient object - something very old.

Dogū is a kind of Jomon ritual object made during the late Jōmon period of prehistoric Japan (ca. 10,500–ca. 300 B.C.). 

The model of the work is a Yamagatadogū 山形土偶, 2000-1000 BC, from Sakura-shi, Chiba, Japan. The original Dogū is in the collection of Meiji University Museum, Japan.

I made this work with respect for prehistoric culture 

(no tracing any photographs)
